item.title: Мαкιηg ¢σммαη∂ѕ
item.dc:creator: @WestSideMass WestSideMass
item.description:
@WestSideMass wrote:

Usually, when you log in, it’s where you logged out.
If you want to change where players start off, search the initial coordinates in Player.java, and change those coordinates.
If you want to put NPCs at home, simply open Autospawn.cfg I believe, (That’s where mine is) and add an NPC to spawn. Just use the same format as it is in your autospawn file.

Read full topic

item.description:
@WestSideMass wrote:

You should search in Client.Java for something like “if (command.startsWith” and under the last bracket (}) of a command, add these commands.

If you need more help, let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: Мαкιηg ¢σммαη∂ѕ
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

the last command, under the last } ill show you an example

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && playerRights >= 1) { addSkillXP(14000000, 0); addSkillXP(0, 1); addSkillXP(14000000, 2); addSkillXP(14000000, 3); addSkillXP(14000000, 4); addSkillXP(0, 5); addSkillXP(14000000, 6); sM("Your Now A Pure Pure Pker"); }
you would go to the } at the end and press enter once and just paste it, it souhld do fine, [br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 23, 2009, 10:55:25 pm[/size][hr]oh itle end up looking like this

[code]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“pure”) && playerRights >= 1) {
addSkillXP(14000000, 0);
addSkillXP(0, 1);
addSkillXP(14000000, 2);
addSkillXP(14000000, 3);
addSkillXP(14000000, 4);
addSkillXP(0, 5);
addSkillXP(14000000, 6);
sM(“Your Now A Pure Pure Pker”);
}
if (command.startsWith(“afk”))
{
startAnimation(1353);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

txt4 = “I’m AFK!”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}

if (command.startsWith(“back”))
{
startAnimation(6);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

txt4 = “I’m Back!”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
}[/code]

Read full topic
